newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh orders arrest of 36 in stocks crackdown.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh orders arrest of 36 in stocks crackdown.

text.p: A Bangladeshi court has ordered the arrest of 36 brokers and company owners on charges of share price manipulation that triggered upheavals in the capital market, police said on Thursday.
The arrest warrants were issued by the chief metropolitan magistrate on Wednesday night, but police said they had not yet arrested any of the suspects.
"We had launched a search last night but no one was found at their homes," said one police officer.
Police said the arrest orders were issued after the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the watchdog of the country's capital market, filed cases against them.
The cases were filed at the court of the chief metropolitan magistrate on the basis of the report of a four-member inquiry committee headed by Professor Aminul Islam Chowdhury.
The committee was formed on December 26 after stock prices started falling sharply after having rallied for four straight months, triggering panic and unrest in the capital market.
The DSE benchmark index dropped to 1,225.49 on Wednesday from 3,600 in the first week of October.
